rows.name: text_top_1
rows.value: By now, your child is so familiar with addition that it’s no surprise that 2 + 3 is the same as 3 + 2. Although not as obvious, the same is true for multiplication. This illustration makes it easy to see that two rows of three is the same as three rows of two – you just change your point of view! It doesn’t matter which order you multiply two numbers – you get the same answer either way!

rows.name: text_bottom_1
rows.value: In addition to being cool in a nerdy way, it also means that your child needs to master only about half as many multiplication facts – once your child knows 3 x 4, they also know 4 x 3.
